result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Edward Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Supervision under probation and parole mental health unit.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.

Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs; no possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol; random urine screens. No contact with victim, UWM Police Officer Steven S or UWM Union Hall.

Provide DNA sample and pay MANDATORY DNA surcharge; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.  Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.  Pay all applicable fees of supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.  Payment Plan for all monetary obligations to be established by Department of Corrections, Probation and Parole.  All unpaid balances at t Pay restitution in the amount of $ZERO;
Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: To be utilized by Department of Corrections, Probation and Parole at their discretion.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief, FILED.
Ineligible Voting Notice And Acknowledgement, FILED.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Charles Edward Evans not in court, in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Janet C Protasiewicz.
Due to jury trial taking place in Branch 22, Plea and Sentencing adjourned to 06-05-2014 at 01:30pm in Branch 22.

Invoice dated: 03-31-2014
Invoice forwarded to A/P on 04-11-2014 in the amount of $343.75 to Dr. Collins for services on 3/12, 3/13/2014. 
COPY IN FILE. sdg

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Charles Edward Evans not in court, in custody.  Janet C. Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties met with Court off the record .  Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Bail was not addressed by the Court on today's date.  Plea and Sentencing scheduled for 05-06-2014 at 01:30pm in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-06-2014 at 01:30 pm.
For Examination Under 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect), FILED.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same Bail.

Defendant Charles Edward Evans in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Charles Edward Evans in custody.   Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense entered a plea of not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.
Court ordered that a BCI Doctor be appointed to examine the defendant for NGI pursuant to Wisc. stats.  971.16.
Order For Examination under 971.16, SIGNED AND FILED.
Court ordered case adjourned for return on the doctor's report to Branch 22.

  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for 03-24-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles Edward Evans in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Charles Edward Evans in custody.  Janet Claire Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Arraignment scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Charles Edward Evans in court with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.  Defendant Charles Edward Evans in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
